heading: HB06269
0: AN ACT GRANTING AUTOMATIC CIVIL SERVICE SUB-PROFESSIONAL ELIGIBILITY TO GRADUATES OF FOUR YEAR COURSES IN COLLEGES OR UNIVERSITIES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
status: Pending with the Committee on CIVIL SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL REGULATION since 2020-02-18
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB06269
FULL TITLE : AN ACT GRANTING AUTOMATIC CIVIL SERVICE SUB-PROFESSIONAL ELIGIBILITY TO GRADUATES OF FOUR YEAR COURSES IN COLLEGES OR UNIVERSITIES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
ABSTRACT : Seeks to provide an incentive for college students to finish their four year courses and enhance the capacity or competencies of graduates of four-year degree programs by automatically entitling them to a sub-professional civil service eligibility. Intends to enable current but efficient, loyal, dependable and deserving government employees without civil service eligibility to acquire job security.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : VIOLAGO, MICAELA S.
DATE FILED : 2020-02-12
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Sy-Alvarado (000 2020-03-03)2. Del Mar (000 2020-11-12)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON CIVIL SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL REGULATION ON 2020-02-18
